WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex issues and suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some issues and feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
The current browser landscape is predominantly ES5 capable (combined of course) and ES3 is no longer the standard of record (http://ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-262.htm).

I understand the desire of backward compatibility, but currently there are no shims/polyfills being included as desugaring for any ES5 API features that are compiled in ES3 mode. In reality, ES3 mode doesn't really exist :)
WorkItem.Summary: ES5 should be the default mode

Comments.Message:
Thanks for the comment.

Assigning to Luke, who has some historical perspective on why we've initially gone ES3.
